PrefixList
^^^^^^^^^^

.. py:class:: PrefixList(prefixListId)

   **Language-specific names:**

   .. tabs::

      .. code-tab:: c#

         using Amazon.CDK.AWS.EC2;

      .. code-tab:: java

         import software.amazon.awscdk.services.ec2.PrefixList;

      .. code-tab:: javascript

         const { PrefixList } = require('@aws-cdk/aws-ec2');

      .. code-tab:: typescript

         import { PrefixList } from '@aws-cdk/aws-ec2';



   A prefix list

   

   Prefix lists are used to allow traffic to VPC-local service endpoints.

   

   For more information, see this page:

   

   https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonVPC/latest/UserGuide/vpc-endpoints.html



   :implements: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.ISecurityGroupRule`\ 
   :implements: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.IConnectable`\ 
   :param prefixListId: 
   :type prefixListId: string

   .. py:method:: toEgressRuleJSON() -> any

      *Implements* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.ISecurityGroupRule.toEgressRuleJSON`

      Produce the egress rule JSON for the given connection



      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: toIngressRuleJSON() -> any

      *Implements* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.ISecurityGroupRule.toIngressRuleJSON`

      Produce the ingress rule JSON for the given connection



      :rtype: any


   .. py:attribute:: canInlineRule

      *Implements* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.ISecurityGroupRule.canInlineRule`

      Whether the rule can be inlined into a SecurityGroup or not



      :type: boolean *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: connections

      *Implements* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.IConnectable.connections`

      :type: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.Connections`\  *(readonly)*

      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: uniqueId

SecurityGroup
^^^^^^^^^^^^^

.. py:class:: SecurityGroup(parent, name, props)

   **Language-specific names:**

   .. tabs::

      .. code-tab:: c#

         using Amazon.CDK.AWS.EC2;

      .. code-tab:: java

         import software.amazon.awscdk.services.ec2.SecurityGroup;

      .. code-tab:: javascript

         const { SecurityGroup } = require('@aws-cdk/aws-ec2');

      .. code-tab:: typescript

         import { SecurityGroup } from '@aws-cdk/aws-ec2';



   Creates an Amazon EC2 security group within a VPC.

   

   This class has an additional optimization over SecurityGroupRef that it can also create

   inline ingress and egress rule (which saves on the total number of resources inside

   the template).



   :extends: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.SecurityGroupRef`\ 
   :implements: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.ITaggable`\ 
   :param parent: 
   :type parent: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 
   :param name: 
   :type name: string
   :param props: 
   :type props: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.SecurityGroupProps`\ 

   .. py:method:: addEgressRule(peer, connection, [description])

      *Overrides* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.SecurityGroupRef.addEgressRule`

      :param peer: 
      :type peer: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.ISecurityGroupRule`\ 
      :param connection: 
      :type connection: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.IPortRange`\ 
      :param description: 
      :type description: string *(optional)*

   .. py:method:: addError(message) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addError>`

      Adds an { error: <message> } metadata entry to this construct.

      The toolkit will fail synthesis when errors are reported.



      :param message: The error message.
      :type message: string
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: addInfo(message) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addInfo>`

      Adds a { "aws:cdk:info": <message> } metadata entry to this construct.

      The toolkit will display the info message when apps are synthesized.



      :param message: The info message.
      :type message: string
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: addMetadata(type, data, [from]) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addMetadata>`

      Adds a metadata entry to this construct.

      Entries are arbitrary values and will also include a stack trace to allow tracing back to

      the code location for when the entry was added. It can be used, for example, to include source

      mapping in CloudFormation templates to improve diagnostics.



      :param type: a string denoting the type of metadata
      :type type: string
      :param data: the value of the metadata (can be a Token). If null/undefined, metadata will not be added.
      :type data: any
      :param from: a function under which to restrict the metadata entry's stack trace (defaults to this.addMetadata)
      :type from: any *(optional)*
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: addWarning(message) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addWarning>`

      Adds a { warning: <message> } metadata entry to this construct.

      The toolkit will display the warning when an app is synthesized, or fail

      if run in --strict mode.



      :param message: The warning message.
      :type message: string
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: ancestors([upTo]) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct[]

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.ancestors>`

      Return the ancestors (including self) of this Construct up until and excluding the indicated component



      :param upTo: 
      :type upTo: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\  *(optional)*

   .. py:method:: findChild(path) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.findChild>`

      Return a descendant by path

      

      Throws an exception if the descendant is not found.

      

      Note that if the original ID of the construct you are looking for contained

      a '/', then it would have been replaced by '--'.



      :param path: 
      :type path: string
      :return: Child with the given path.
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: getContext(key) -> any

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.getContext>`

      Retrieves a value from tree context.

      

      Context is usually initialized at the root, but can be overridden at any point in the tree.



      :param key: The context key
      :type key: string
      :return: The context value or undefined
      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: lock()

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.lock>`

      Locks this construct from allowing more children to be added. After this

      call, no more children can be added to this construct or to any children.



      *Protected method*



   .. py:method:: requireContext(key) -> any

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.requireContext>`

      Retrieve a value from tree-global context

      

      It is an error if the context object is not available.



      :param key: 
      :type key: string
      :rtype: any

      In the future we can add some type-checking here, maybe even auto-generate during compilation.



      *Protected method*

      :type props: any
      :param name: The name of the required property.
      :type name: string
      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: setContext(key, value)

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.setContext>`

      This can be used to set contextual values.

      Context must be set before any children are added, since children may consult context info during construction.

      If the key already exists, it will be overridden.



      :param key: The context key
      :type key: string
      :param value: The context value
      :type value: any

      validation logic. It is called on all constructs before synthesis.



      :return: An array of validation error messages, or an empty array if there the construct is valid.
      :rtype: string[]


   .. py:method:: validateTree() -> @aws-cdk/cdk.ValidationError[]

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.validateTree>`

      Invokes 'validate' on all child constructs and then on this construct (depth-first).



      :return: A list of validation errors. If the list is empty, all constructs are valid.
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.ValidationError`\ []


   .. py:attribute:: children

      :type: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ [] *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: id

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.id>`

      The local id of the construct.

      This id is unique amongst its siblings.

      To obtain a tree-global unique id for this construct, use `uniqueId`.



      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: locked

      *Protected property*

      :type: boolean *(readonly)*

      :type: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.MetadataEntry`\ [] *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: path

      Components are separated by '/'.



      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: uniqueId

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.uniqueId>`

      Includes all components of the tree.



      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: parent

      :type: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\  *(optional)* *(readonly)*


SecurityGroupProps (interface)
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

.. py:class:: SecurityGroupProps

   **Language-specific names:**

   .. tabs::

      .. code-tab:: c#

         using Amazon.CDK.AWS.EC2;

      .. code-tab:: java

         import software.amazon.awscdk.services.ec2.SecurityGroupProps;

      .. code-tab:: javascript

         // SecurityGroupProps is an interface

      .. code-tab:: typescript

         import { SecurityGroupProps } from '@aws-cdk/aws-ec2';





   .. py:attribute:: vpc

      The VPC in which to create the security group.



      :type: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcNetworkRef`\ 


   .. py:attribute:: allowAllOutbound

      Whether to allow all outbound traffic by default.

      

      If this is set to true, there will only be a single egress rule which allows all

      outbound traffic. If this is set to false, no outbound traffic will be allowed by

      default and all egress traffic must be explicitly authorized.



      :type: boolean *(optional)*
      :default: true


   .. py:attribute:: description

      A description of the security group.



      :type: string *(optional)*
      :default: The default name will be the construct's CDK path.


   .. py:attribute:: groupName

      The name of the security group. For valid values, see the GroupName

      parameter of the CreateSecurityGroup action in the Amazon EC2 API

      Reference.

      

      It is not recommended to use an explicit group name.



      :type: string *(optional)*
      :default: If you don't specify a GroupName, AWS CloudFormation generates a
unique physical ID and uses that ID for the group name.


   .. py:attribute:: tags

      The AWS resource tags to associate with the security group.



      :type: string => string *(optional)*


SecurityGroupRef
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

.. py:class:: SecurityGroupRef(parent, id)

   **Language-specific names:**

   .. tabs::

      .. code-tab:: c#

         using Amazon.CDK.AWS.EC2;

      .. code-tab:: java

         import software.amazon.awscdk.services.ec2.SecurityGroupRef;

      .. code-tab:: javascript

         const { SecurityGroupRef } = require('@aws-cdk/aws-ec2');

      .. code-tab:: typescript

         import { SecurityGroupRef } from '@aws-cdk/aws-ec2';



   A SecurityGroup that is not created in this template



   :extends: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 
   :implements: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.ISecurityGroupRule`\ 
   :implements: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.IConnectable`\ 
   :abstract: Yes
   :param parent: The parent construct
   :type parent: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 
   :param id: The local logical ID of the construct. Must be unique amongst siblings. If the ID includes a path separator (`/`), then it will be replaced by double dash `--`.
   :type id: string

   .. py:staticmethod:: import(parent, id, props) -> @aws-cdk/aws-ec2.SecurityGroupRef

      Import an existing SecurityGroup



      :param parent: 
      :type parent: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 
      :param id: 
      :type id: string
      :param props: 
      :type props: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.SecurityGroupRefProps`\ 
      :rtype: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.SecurityGroupRef`\ 


   .. py:method:: addEgressRule(peer, connection, [description])

      :param peer: 
      :type peer: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.ISecurityGroupRule`\ 
      :param connection: 
      :type connection: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.IPortRange`\ 
      :param description: 
      :type description: string *(optional)*


   .. py:method:: addIngressRule(peer, connection, [description])

      :param peer: 
      :type peer: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.ISecurityGroupRule`\ 
      :param connection: 
      :type connection: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.IPortRange`\ 
      :param description: 
      :type description: string *(optional)*


   .. py:method:: export() -> @aws-cdk/aws-ec2.SecurityGroupRefProps

      Export this SecurityGroup for use in a different Stack



      :rtype: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.SecurityGroupRefProps`\

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.validateTree>`

      Invokes 'validate' on all child constructs and then on this construct (depth-first).



      :return: A list of validation errors. If the list is empty, all constructs are valid.
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.ValidationError`\ []


   .. py:attribute:: children

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.children>`

      All direct children of this construct.



      :type: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ [] *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: id

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.id>`

      The local id of the construct.

      This id is unique amongst its siblings.

      To obtain a tree-global unique id for this construct, use `uniqueId`.



      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: locked

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.locked>`

      Returns true if this construct or any of it's parent constructs are

      locked.



      *Protected property*

      :type: boolean *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: metadata

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.metadata>`

      An array of metadata objects associated with this construct.

      This can be used, for example, to implement support for deprecation notices, source mapping, etc.



      :type: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.MetadataEntry`\ [] *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: path

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.path>`

      The full path of this construct in the tree.

      Components are separated by '/'.



      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: uniqueId

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.uniqueId>`

      A tree-global unique alphanumeric identifier for this construct.

      Includes all components of the tree.



      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: parent

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.parent>`

      Returns the parent of this node or undefined if this is a root node.



      :type: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\  *(optional)* *(readonly)*

SubnetConfiguration (interface)
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

.. py:class:: SubnetConfiguration

   **Language-specific names:**

   .. tabs::

      .. code-tab:: c#

         using Amazon.CDK.AWS.EC2;

      .. code-tab:: java

         import software.amazon.awscdk.services.ec2.SubnetConfiguration;

      .. code-tab:: javascript

         // SubnetConfiguration is an interface

      .. code-tab:: typescript

         import { SubnetConfiguration } from '@aws-cdk/aws-ec2';



   Specify configuration parameters for a VPC to be built





   .. py:attribute:: name

      The common Logical Name for the `VpcSubnet`

      

      Thi name will be suffixed with an integer correlating to a specific

      availability zone.



      :type: string


   .. py:attribute:: subnetType

      The type of Subnet to configure.

      

      The Subnet type will control the ability to route and connect to the

      Internet.



      :type: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.SubnetType`\ 


   .. py:attribute:: cidrMask

      The CIDR Mask or the number of leading 1 bits in the routing mask

      

      Valid values are 16 - 28



      :type: number *(optional)*


   .. py:attribute:: tags

      The AWS resource tags to associate with the resource.



      :type: string => string *(optional)*

   :extends: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token`\ 
   :param valueOrFunction: What this token will evaluate to, literal or function.
   :type valueOrFunction: any *(optional)*
   :param displayName: A human-readable display hint for this Token
   :type displayName: string *(optional)*

   .. py:method:: concat(left, right) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Token

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.concat>`

      Return a concated version of this Token in a string context

      

      The default implementation of this combines strings, but specialized

      implements of Token can return a more appropriate value.



      :param left: 
      :type left: any
      :param right: 
      :type right: any
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token`\ 


   .. py:method:: resolve() -> any

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.resolve>`

      :return: The resolved value for this token.
      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: toJSON() -> any

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.toJSON>`

      Turn this Token into JSON

      

      This gets called by JSON.stringify(). We want to prohibit this, because

      it's not possible to do this properly, so we just throw an error here.



      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: toList() -> string[]

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.toList>`

      Return a string list representation of this token

      

      Call this if the Token intrinsically evaluates to a list of strings.

      If so, you can represent the Token in a similar way in the type

      system.

      

      Note that even though the Token is represented as a list of strings, you

      still cannot do any operations on it such as concatenation, indexing,

      or taking its length. The only useful operations you can do to these lists

      is constructing a `FnJoin` or a `FnSelect` on it.



      :rtype: string[]


   .. py:method:: toString() -> string

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.toString>`

      Return a reversible string representation of this token

      

      If the Token is initialized with a literal, the stringified value of the

      literal is returned. Otherwise, a special quoted string representation

      of the Token is returned that can be embedded into other strings.

      

      Strings with quoted Tokens in them can be restored back into

      complex values with the Tokens restored by calling `resolve()`

      on the string.



      :rtype: string


   .. py:attribute:: displayName

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.displayName>`

      A human-readable display hint for this Token



      :type: string *(optional)* *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: valueOrFunction

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.valueOrFunction>`

      What this token will evaluate to, literal or function.



      :type: any *(optional)* *(readonly)*


SubnetType (enum)
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

.. py:class:: SubnetType

   **Language-specific names:**

   .. tabs::

      .. code-tab:: c#

         using Amazon.CDK.AWS.EC2;

      .. code-tab:: java

         import software.amazon.awscdk.services.ec2.SubnetType;

      .. code-tab:: javascript

         const { SubnetType } = require('@aws-cdk/aws-ec2');

      .. code-tab:: typescript

         import { SubnetType } from '@aws-cdk/aws-ec2';



   The type of Subnet



   .. py:data:: Isolated

   Isolated Subnets do not route Outbound traffic

   

   This can be good for subnets with RDS or

   Elasticache endpoints



   .. py:data:: Private

   Subnet that routes to the internet, but not vice versa.

   

   Instances in a private subnet can connect to the Internet, but will not

   allow connections to be initiated from the Internet.

   

   Outbound traffic will be routed via a NAT Gateway. Preference being in

   the same AZ, but if not available will use another AZ (control by

   specifing `maxGateways` on VpcNetwork). This might be used for

   experimental cost conscious accounts or accounts where HA outbound

   traffic is not needed.



   .. py:data:: Public

   Subnet connected to the Internet

   

   Instances in a Public subnet can connect to the Internet and can be

   connected to from the Internet as long as they are launched with public

   IPs (controlled on the AutoScalingGroup or other constructs that launch

   instances).

   

   Public subnets route outbound traffic via an Internet Gateway.

   :type displayName: string *(optional)*

   .. py:method:: concat(left, right) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Token

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.concat>`

      Turn this Token into JSON

      

      This gets called by JSON.stringify(). We want to prohibit this, because

      it's not possible to do this properly, so we just throw an error here.



      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: toList() -> string[]

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.toList>`

      Return a string list representation of this token

      

      Call this if the Token intrinsically evaluates to a list of strings.

      If so, you can represent the Token in a similar way in the type

      system.

      

      Note that even though the Token is represented as a list of strings, you

      still cannot do any operations on it such as concatenation, indexing,

      or taking its length. The only useful operations you can do to these lists

      is constructing a `FnJoin` or a `FnSelect` on it.



      :rtype: string[]


   .. py:method:: toString() -> string

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.toString>`

      Return a reversible string representation of this token

      

      If the Token is initialized with a literal, the stringified value of the

      literal is returned. Otherwise, a special quoted string representation

      of the Token is returned that can be embedded into other strings.

      

      Strings with quoted Tokens in them can be restored back into

      complex values with the Tokens restored by calling `resolve()`

      on the string.



      :rtype: string


   .. py:attribute:: displayName

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.displayName>`

      A human-readable display hint for this Token



      :type: string *(optional)* *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: valueOrFunction

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.valueOrFunction>`

      What this token will evaluate to, literal or function.



      :type: any *(optional)* *(readonly)*

      :rtype: string[]


   .. py:method:: toString() -> string

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.toString>`

      Return a reversible string representation of this token

      

      If the Token is initialized with a literal, the stringified value of the

      literal is returned. Otherwise, a special quoted string representation

      of the Token is returned that can be embedded into other strings.

      

      Strings with quoted Tokens in them can be restored back into

      complex values with the Tokens restored by calling `resolve()`

      on the string.



      :rtype: string


   .. py:attribute:: displayName

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.displayName>`

      A human-readable display hint for this Token



      :type: string *(optional)* *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: valueOrFunction

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.valueOrFunction>`

      What this token will evaluate to, literal or function.



      :type: any *(optional)* *(readonly)*


VPCEndpointNetworkInterfaceIds

   **Language-specific names:**

   :extends: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token`\ 
   :param valueOrFunction: What this token will evaluate to, literal or function.
   :type valueOrFunction: any *(optional)*
   :param displayName: A human-readable display hint for this Token
   :type displayName: string *(optional)*

   .. py:method:: concat(left, right) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Token

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.concat>`

      Return a concated version of this Token in a string context

      

      The default implementation of this combines strings, but specialized

      implements of Token can return a more appropriate value.



      :param left: 
      :type left: any
      :param right: 
      :type right: any
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token`\ 


   .. py:method:: resolve() -> any

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.resolve>`

      :return: The resolved value for this token.
      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: toJSON() -> any

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.toJSON>`

      Turn this Token into JSON

      

      This gets called by JSON.stringify(). We want to prohibit this, because

      it's not possible to do this properly, so we just throw an error here.



      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: toList() -> string[]

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.toList>`

      Return a string list representation of this token

      

      Call this if the Token intrinsically evaluates to a list of strings.

      If so, you can represent the Token in a similar way in the type

      system.

      

      Note that even though the Token is represented as a list of strings, you

      still cannot do any operations on it such as concatenation, indexing,

      or taking its length. The only useful operations you can do to these lists

      is constructing a `FnJoin` or a `FnSelect` on it.



      :rtype: string[]


   .. py:method:: toString() -> string

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.toString>`

      Return a reversible string representation of this token

      

      If the Token is initialized with a literal, the stringified value of the

      literal is returned. Otherwise, a special quoted string representation

      of the Token is returned that can be embedded into other strings.

      

      Strings with quoted Tokens in them can be restored back into

      complex values with the Tokens restored by calling `resolve()`

      on the string.



      :rtype: string


   .. py:attribute:: displayName

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.displayName>`

      A human-readable display hint for this Token



      :type: string *(optional)* *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: valueOrFunction

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Token <@aws-cdk/cdk.Token.valueOrFunction>`

      What this token will evaluate to, literal or function.



      :type: any *(optional)* *(readonly)*

VpcNetwork
^^^^^^^^^^

.. py:class:: VpcNetwork(parent, name, [props])

   **Language-specific names:**

   .. tabs::

      .. code-tab:: c#

         using Amazon.CDK.AWS.EC2;

      .. code-tab:: java

         import software.amazon.awscdk.services.ec2.VpcNetwork;

      .. code-tab:: javascript

         const { VpcNetwork } = require('@aws-cdk/aws-ec2');

      .. code-tab:: typescript

         import { VpcNetwork } from '@aws-cdk/aws-ec2';



   VpcNetwork deploys an AWS VPC, with public and private subnets per Availability Zone.

   For example:

   

   import { VpcNetwork } from '@aws-cdk/aws-ec2'

   

   const vpc = new VpcNetwork(this, {

      cidr: "10.0.0.0/16"

   })

   

   // Iterate the public subnets

   for (let subnet of vpc.publicSubnets) {

   

   }

   

   // Iterate the private subnets

   for (let subnet of vpc.privateSubnets) {

   

   }



   :extends: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcNetworkRef`\ 
   :implements: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.ITaggable`\ 
   :param parent: 
   :type parent: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 
   :param name: 
   :type name: string
   :param props: 
   :type props: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcNetworkProps`\  *(optional)*

   .. py:attribute:: DEFAULT_CIDR_RANGE

      The default CIDR range used when creating VPCs.

      This can be overridden using VpcNetworkProps when creating a VPCNetwork resource.

      e.g. new VpcResource(this, { cidr: '192.168.0.0./16' })



      :type: string *(readonly)* *(static)*


   .. py:attribute:: DEFAULT_SUBNETS

      The default subnet configuration

      

      1 Public and 1 Private subnet per AZ evenly split



      :type: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.SubnetConfiguration`\ [] *(readonly)* *(static)*


   .. py:attribute:: availabilityZones

      *Implements* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcNetworkRef.availabilityZones`

      AZs for this VPC



      :type: string[] *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: cidr

      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: isolatedSubnets

      :type: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcSubnetRef`\ [] *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: privateSubnets

      *Implements* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcNetworkRef.privateSubnets`

      :type: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcSubnetRef`\ [] *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: publicSubnets

      *Implements* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcNetworkRef.publicSubnets`

   .. py:method:: internetDependency() -> @aws-cdk/cdk.IDependable

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcNetworkRef <@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcNetworkRef.internetDependency>`

      added to the VPC before they can be constructed.

      

      This method is for construct authors; application builders should not

      need to call this.

   .. py:method:: isPublicSubnet(subnet) -> boolean

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcNetworkRef <@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcNetworkRef.isPublicSubnet>`

      Return whether the given subnet is one of this VPC's public subnets.

      

      The subnet must literally be one of the subnet object obtained from

      this VPC. A subnet that merely represents the same subnet will

      never return true.



      :param subnet:

   .. py:method:: addMetadata(type, data, [from]) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addMetadata>`

      Adds a metadata entry to this construct.

      Entries are arbitrary values and will also include a stack trace to allow tracing back to

      the code location for when the entry was added. It can be used, for example, to include source

      mapping in CloudFormation templates to improve diagnostics.



      :param type: a string denoting the type of metadata
      :type type: string
      :param data: the value of the metadata (can be a Token). If null/undefined, metadata will not be added.
      :type data: any
      :param from: a function under which to restrict the metadata entry's stack trace (defaults to this.addMetadata)
      :type from: any *(optional)*
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\

      if run in --strict mode.

VpcNetworkProps (interface)
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

.. py:class:: VpcNetworkProps

   **Language-specific names:**

   .. tabs::

      .. code-tab:: c#

         using Amazon.CDK.AWS.EC2;

      .. code-tab:: java

         import software.amazon.awscdk.services.ec2.VpcNetworkProps;

      .. code-tab:: javascript

         // VpcNetworkProps is an interface

      .. code-tab:: typescript

         import { VpcNetworkProps } from '@aws-cdk/aws-ec2';



   VpcNetworkProps allows you to specify configuration options for a VPC





   .. py:attribute:: cidr

      The CIDR range to use for the VPC (e.g. '10.0.0.0/16'). Should be a minimum of /28 and maximum size of /16.

      The range will be split evenly into two subnets per Availability Zone (one public, one private).



      :type: string *(optional)*


   .. py:attribute:: defaultInstanceTenancy

      The default tenancy of instances launched into the VPC.

      By default, instances will be launched with default (shared) tenancy.

      By setting this to dedicated tenancy, instances will be launched on hardware dedicated

      to a single AWS customer, unless specifically specified at instance launch time.

      Please note, not all instance types are usable with Dedicated tenancy.



      :type: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.DefaultInstanceTenancy`\  *(optional)*


   .. py:attribute:: enableDnsHostnames

      Indicates whether the instances launched in the VPC get public DNS hostnames.

      If this attribute is true, instances in the VPC get public DNS hostnames,

      but only if the enableDnsSupport attribute is also set to true.



      :type: boolean *(optional)*


   .. py:attribute:: enableDnsSupport

      Indicates whether the DNS resolution is supported for the VPC. If this attribute

      is false, the Amazon-provided DNS server in the VPC that resolves public DNS hostnames

      to IP addresses is not enabled. If this attribute is true, queries to the Amazon

      provided DNS server at the 169.254.169.253 IP address, or the reserved IP address

      at the base of the VPC IPv4 network range plus two will succeed.



      :type: boolean *(optional)*


   .. py:attribute:: maxAZs

      Define the maximum number of AZs to use in this region

      

      If the region has more AZs than you want to use (for example, because of EIP limits),

      pick a lower number here. The AZs will be sorted and picked from the start of the list.



      :type: number *(optional)*
      :default: All AZs in the region


   .. py:attribute:: natGatewayPlacement

      Configures the subnets which will have NAT Gateways

      

      You can pick a specific group of subnets by specifying the group name;

      the picked subnets must be public subnets.



      :type: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcPlacementStrategy`\  *(optional)*
      :default: All public subnets


   .. py:attribute:: natGateways

      The number of NAT Gateways to create.

      

      For example, if set this to 1 and your subnet configuration is for 3 Public subnets then only

      one of the Public subnets will have a gateway and all Private subnets will route to this NAT Gateway.



      :type: number *(optional)*
      :default: maxAZs


   .. py:attribute:: subnetConfiguration

      Configure the subnets to build for each AZ

      

      The subnets are constructed in the context of the VPC so you only need

      specify the configuration. The VPC details (VPC ID, specific CIDR,

      specific AZ will be calculated during creation)

      

      For example if you want 1 public subnet, 1 private subnet, and 1 isolated

      subnet in each AZ provide the following:

      subnetConfiguration: [

          {

            cidrMask: 24,

            name: 'ingress',

            subnetType: SubnetType.Public,

          },

          {

            cidrMask: 24,

            name: 'application',

            subnetType: SubnetType.Private,

          },

          {

            cidrMask: 28,

            name: 'rds',

            subnetType: SubnetType.Isolated,

          }

      ]

      

      `cidrMask` is optional and if not provided the IP space in the VPC will be

      evenly divided between the requested subnets.



      :type: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.SubnetConfiguration`\ [] *(optional)*
      :default: the VPC CIDR will be evenly divided between 1 public and 1
private subnet per AZ


   .. py:attribute:: tags

      The AWS resource tags to associate with the VPC.



      :type: string => string *(optional)*


VpcNetworkProvider
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

.. py:class:: VpcNetworkProvider(context, props)

   **Language-specific names:**

   .. tabs::

      .. code-tab:: c#

         using Amazon.CDK.AWS.EC2;

      .. code-tab:: java

         import software.amazon.awscdk.services.ec2.VpcNetworkProvider;

      .. code-tab:: javascript

         const { VpcNetworkProvider } = require('@aws-cdk/aws-ec2');

      .. code-tab:: typescript

         import { VpcNetworkProvider } from '@aws-cdk/aws-ec2';



   Context provider to discover and import existing VPCs



   :param context: 
   :type context: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 
   :param props: 
   :type props: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcNetworkProviderProps`\ 

   .. py:attribute:: vpcProps

      Return the VPC import props matching the filter



      :type: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcNetworkRefProps`\  *(readonly)*


VpcNetworkProviderProps (interface)
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

.. py:class:: VpcNetworkProviderProps

   **Language-specific names:**

   .. tabs::

      .. code-tab:: c#

         using Amazon.CDK.AWS.EC2;

      .. code-tab:: java

         import software.amazon.awscdk.services.ec2.VpcNetworkProviderProps;

      .. code-tab:: javascript

         // VpcNetworkProviderProps is an interface

      .. code-tab:: typescript

         import { VpcNetworkProviderProps } from '@aws-cdk/aws-ec2';



   Properties for looking up an existing VPC.

   

   The combination of properties must specify filter down to exactly one

   non-default VPC, otherwise an error is raised.





   .. py:attribute:: isDefault

      Whether to match the default VPC



      :type: boolean *(optional)*
      :default: Don't care whether we return the default VPC


   .. py:attribute:: tags

      Tags on the VPC

      

      The VPC must have all of these tags



      :type: string => string *(optional)*
      :default: Don't filter on tags


   .. py:attribute:: vpcId

      The ID of the VPC

      

      If given, will import exactly this VPC.



      :type: string *(optional)*
      :default: Don't filter on vpcId


   .. py:attribute:: vpcName

      The name of the VPC

      

      If given, will import the VPC with this name.



      :type: string *(optional)*
      :default: Don't filter on vpcName


VpcNetworkRef
^^^^^^^^^^^^^

.. py:class:: VpcNetworkRef(parent, id)

   **Language-specific names:**

   .. tabs::

      .. code-tab:: c#

      .. code-tab:: java

   A new or imported VPC



   :extends: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 
   :implements: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.IDependable`\ 
   :abstract: Yes
   :param parent: The parent construct
   :type parent: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 
   :param id: The local logical ID of the construct. Must be unique amongst siblings. If the ID includes a path separator (`/`), then it will be replaced by double dash `--`.
   :type id: string

   .. py:staticmethod:: import(parent, name, props) -> @aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcNetworkRef

      Export this VPC from the stack



      :rtype: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcNetworkRefProps`\ 


   .. py:method:: internetDependency() -> @aws-cdk/cdk.IDependable

      Take a dependency on internet connectivity having been added to this VPC

      

      Take a dependency on this if your constructs need an Internet Gateway

      added to the VPC before they can be constructed.

      

      This method is for construct authors; application builders should not

      need to call this.



      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.IDependable`\ 


   .. py:method:: isPublicSubnet(subnet) -> boolean

      Return whether the given subnet is one of this VPC's public subnets.

      

      The subnet must literally be one of the subnet object obtained from

      this VPC. A subnet that merely represents the same subnet will

      never return true.



      :param subnet: 
      :type subnet: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcSubnetRef`\ 
      :rtype: boolean


   .. py:method:: subnets([placement]) -> @aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcSubnetRef[]

      :param placement: 
      :type placement: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcPlacementStrategy`\  *(optional)*

   .. py:method:: addMetadata(type, data, [from]) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addMetadata>`

      Adds a metadata entry to this construct.

      Entries are arbitrary values and will also include a stack trace to allow tracing back to

      the code location for when the entry was added. It can be used, for example, to include source

      mapping in CloudFormation templates to improve diagnostics.



      :param type: a string denoting the type of metadata
      :type type: string
      :param data: the value of the metadata (can be a Token). If null/undefined, metadata will not be added.
      :type data: any
      :param from: a function under which to restrict the metadata entry's stack trace (defaults to this.addMetadata)
      :type from: any *(optional)*
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: addWarning(message) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      The toolkit will display the warning when an app is synthesized, or fail

      if run in --strict mode.



      :param message: The warning message.
      :type message: string
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\

   Properties that reference an external VpcNetwork





   .. py:attribute:: availabilityZones

      List of availability zones for the subnets in this VPC.



      :type: string[]


   .. py:attribute:: vpcId

      VPC's identifier



      :type: string


   .. py:attribute:: isolatedSubnetIds

      List of isolated subnet IDs

      

      Must be undefined or match the availability zones in length and order.



      :type: string[] *(optional)*


   .. py:attribute:: isolatedSubnetNames

      List of names for the isolated subnets

      

      Must be undefined or have a name for every isolated subnet group.



      :type: string[] *(optional)*


   .. py:attribute:: privateSubnetIds

      List of private subnet IDs

      

      Must be undefined or match the availability zones in length and order.



      :type: string[] *(optional)*


   .. py:attribute:: privateSubnetNames

      List of names for the private subnets

      

      Must be undefined or have a name for every private subnet group.



      :type: string[] *(optional)*


   .. py:attribute:: publicSubnetIds

      Must be undefined or match the availability zones in length and order.



      :type: string[] *(optional)*


   .. py:attribute:: publicSubnetNames

      Must be undefined or have a name for every public subnet group.



      :type: string[] *(optional)*


VpcPlacementStrategy (interface)
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

.. py:class:: VpcPlacementStrategy

   **Language-specific names:**

   .. tabs::

      .. code-tab:: c#

         using Amazon.CDK.AWS.EC2;

      .. code-tab:: java

         import software.amazon.awscdk.services.ec2.VpcPlacementStrategy;

      .. code-tab:: javascript

         // VpcPlacementStrategy is an interface

      .. code-tab:: typescript

         import { VpcPlacementStrategy } from '@aws-cdk/aws-ec2';



   Customize how instances are placed inside a VPC

   

   Constructs that allow customization of VPC placement use parameters of this

   type to provide placement settings.

   

   By default, the instances are placed in the private subnets.





   .. py:attribute:: subnetName

      Place the instances in the subnets with the given name

      

      (This is the name supplied in subnetConfiguration).

      

      At most one of `subnetsToUse` and `subnetName` can be supplied.



      :type: string *(optional)*
      :default: name


   .. py:attribute:: subnetsToUse

      Place the instances in the subnets of the given type

      

      At most one of `subnetsToUse` and `subnetName` can be supplied.



      :type: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.SubnetType`\  *(optional)*
      :default: SubnetType.Private

   .. py:method:: addError(message) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addError>`

      Adds an { error: <message> } metadata entry to this construct.

      The toolkit will fail synthesis when errors are reported.



      :param message: The error message.
      :type message: string
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: addInfo(message) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addInfo>`

      Adds a { "aws:cdk:info": <message> } metadata entry to this construct.

      The toolkit will display the info message when apps are synthesized.



      :param message: The info message.
      :type message: string
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: addMetadata(type, data, [from]) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addMetadata>`

      Adds a metadata entry to this construct.

      Entries are arbitrary values and will also include a stack trace to allow tracing back to

      the code location for when the entry was added. It can be used, for example, to include source

      mapping in CloudFormation templates to improve diagnostics.



      :param type: a string denoting the type of metadata
      :type type: string
      :param data: the value of the metadata (can be a Token). If null/undefined, metadata will not be added.
      :type data: any
      :param from: a function under which to restrict the metadata entry's stack trace (defaults to this.addMetadata)
      :type from: any *(optional)*
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: addWarning(message) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addWarning>`

      Adds a { warning: <message> } metadata entry to this construct.

      The toolkit will display the warning when an app is synthesized, or fail

      if run in --strict mode.



      :param message: The warning message.
      :type message: string
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: ancestors([upTo]) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct[]

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.ancestors>`

      Return the ancestors (including self) of this Construct up until and excluding the indicated component



      :param upTo: 
      :type upTo: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\  *(optional)*
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ []


   .. py:method:: findChild(path) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.findChild>`

      Return a descendant by path

      

      Throws an exception if the descendant is not found.

      

      Note that if the original ID of the construct you are looking for contained

      a '/', then it would have been replaced by '--'.



      :param path: 
      :type path: string
      :return: Child with the given path.
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: getContext(key) -> any

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.getContext>`

      Retrieves a value from tree context.

      

      Context is usually initialized at the root, but can be overridden at any point in the tree.



      :param key: The context key
      :type key: string
      :return: The context value or undefined
      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: lock()

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.lock>`

      Locks this construct from allowing more children to be added. After this

      call, no more children can be added to this construct or to any children.



      *Protected method*



   .. py:method:: requireContext(key) -> any

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.requireContext>`

      Retrieve a value from tree-global context

      

      It is an error if the context object is not available.



      :param key: 
      :type key: string
      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: required(props, name) -> any

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.required>`

      Throws if the `props` bag doesn't include the property `name`.

      In the future we can add some type-checking here, maybe even auto-generate during compilation.



      *Protected method*

      :param props: The props bag.
      :type props: any
      :param name: The name of the required property.
      :type name: string
      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: setContext(key, value)

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.setContext>`

      This can be used to set contextual values.

      Context must be set before any children are added, since children may consult context info during construction.

      If the key already exists, it will be overridden.



      :param key: The context key
      :type key: string
      :param value: The context value
      :type value: any


   .. py:method:: toString() -> string

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.toString>`

      Returns a string representation of this construct.



      :rtype: string


   .. py:method:: toTreeString([depth]) -> string

      Returns a string with a tree representation of this construct and it's children.



      :param depth: 
      :type depth: number *(optional)*
      :rtype: string


   .. py:method:: tryFindChild(path) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.tryFindChild>`

      Return a descendant by path, or undefined

      

      Note that if the original ID of the construct you are looking for contained

      a '/', then it would have been replaced by '--'.



      :param path: 
      :type path: string
      :return: a child by path or undefined if not found.
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\  *(optional)*


   .. py:method:: unlock()

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.unlock>`

      Unlocks this costruct and allows mutations (adding children).



      *Protected method*



   .. py:method:: validate() -> string[]

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.validate>`

      This method can be implemented by derived constructs in order to perform

      validation logic. It is called on all constructs before synthesis.



      :return: An array of validation error messages, or an empty array if there the construct is valid.
      :rtype: string[]


   .. py:method:: validateTree() -> @aws-cdk/cdk.ValidationError[]

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.validateTree>`

      Invokes 'validate' on all child constructs and then on this construct (depth-first).



      :return: A list of validation errors. If the list is empty, all constructs are valid.
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.ValidationError`\ []


   .. py:attribute:: children

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.children>`

      All direct children of this construct.



      :type: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ [] *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: id

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.id>`

      The local id of the construct.

      This id is unique amongst its siblings.

      To obtain a tree-global unique id for this construct, use `uniqueId`.



      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: locked

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.locked>`

      Returns true if this construct or any of it's parent constructs are

      locked.



      *Protected property*

      :type: boolean *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: metadata

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.metadata>`

      An array of metadata objects associated with this construct.

      This can be used, for example, to implement support for deprecation notices, source mapping, etc.



      :type: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.MetadataEntry`\ [] *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: path

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.path>`

      The full path of this construct in the tree.

      Components are separated by '/'.



      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: uniqueId

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.uniqueId>`

      A tree-global unique alphanumeric identifier for this construct.

      Includes all components of the tree.



      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: parent

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.parent>`

      Returns the parent of this node or undefined if this is a root node.



      :type: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\  *(optional)* *(readonly)*

      :return: The resolved path part name of the child


   .. py:method:: addError(message) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addError>`

      Adds an { error: <message> } metadata entry to this construct.

      The toolkit will fail synthesis when errors are reported.



      :param message: The error message.
      :type message: string
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: addInfo(message) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addInfo>`

      Adds a { "aws:cdk:info": <message> } metadata entry to this construct.

      The toolkit will display the info message when apps are synthesized.



      :param message: The info message.
      :type message: string
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: addMetadata(type, data, [from]) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addMetadata>`

      Adds a metadata entry to this construct.

      Entries are arbitrary values and will also include a stack trace to allow tracing back to

      the code location for when the entry was added. It can be used, for example, to include source

      mapping in CloudFormation templates to improve diagnostics.



      :param type: a string denoting the type of metadata
      :type type: string
      :param data: the value of the metadata (can be a Token). If null/undefined, metadata will not be added.
      :type data: any
      :param from: a function under which to restrict the metadata entry's stack trace (defaults to this.addMetadata)
      :type from: any *(optional)*
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: addWarning(message) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addWarning>`

      Adds a { warning: <message> } metadata entry to this construct.

      The toolkit will display the warning when an app is synthesized, or fail

      if run in --strict mode.



      :param message: The warning message.
      :type message: string
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: ancestors([upTo]) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct[]

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.ancestors>`

      Return the ancestors (including self) of this Construct up until and excluding the indicated component



      :param upTo: 
      :type upTo: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\  *(optional)*
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ []


   .. py:method:: findChild(path) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.findChild>`

      Return a descendant by path

      

      Throws an exception if the descendant is not found.

      

      Note that if the original ID of the construct you are looking for contained

      a '/', then it would have been replaced by '--'.



      :param path: 
      :type path: string
      :return: Child with the given path.
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: getContext(key) -> any

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.getContext>`

      Retrieves a value from tree context.

      

      Context is usually initialized at the root, but can be overridden at any point in the tree.



      :param key: The context key
      :type key: string
      :return: The context value or undefined
      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: lock()

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.lock>`

      Locks this construct from allowing more children to be added. After this

      call, no more children can be added to this construct or to any children.



      *Protected method*



   .. py:method:: requireContext(key) -> any

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.requireContext>`

      Retrieve a value from tree-global context

      

      It is an error if the context object is not available.



      :param key: 
      :type key: string
      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: required(props, name) -> any

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.required>`

      Throws if the `props` bag doesn't include the property `name`.

      In the future we can add some type-checking here, maybe even auto-generate during compilation.



      *Protected method*

      :param props: The props bag.
      :type props: any
      :param name: The name of the required property.
      :type name: string
      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: setContext(key, value)

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.setContext>`

      This can be used to set contextual values.

      Context must be set before any children are added, since children may consult context info during construction.

      If the key already exists, it will be overridden.



      :param key: The context key
      :type key: string
      :param value: The context value
      :type value: any


   .. py:method:: toString() -> string

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.toString>`

      Returns a string representation of this construct.



      :rtype: string


   .. py:method:: toTreeString([depth]) -> string

      Returns a string with a tree representation of this construct and it's children.



      :param depth: 
      :type depth: number *(optional)*
      :rtype: string


   .. py:method:: tryFindChild(path) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.tryFindChild>`

      a '/', then it would have been replaced by '--'.



      :param path: 
      :type path: string

   .. py:method:: unlock()

      *Protected method*



   .. py:method:: validate() -> string[]

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.validate>`

      This method can be implemented by derived constructs in order to perform

      validation logic. It is called on all constructs before synthesis.



      :return: An array of validation error messages, or an empty array if there the construct is valid.
      :rtype: string[]


   .. py:method:: validateTree() -> @aws-cdk/cdk.ValidationError[]

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.validateTree>`

      Invokes 'validate' on all child constructs and then on this construct (depth-first).



      :return: A list of validation errors. If the list is empty, all constructs are valid.
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.ValidationError`\ []


   .. py:attribute:: children

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.children>`

      All direct children of this construct.



      :type: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ [] *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: id

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.id>`

      The local id of the construct.

      This id is unique amongst its siblings.

      To obtain a tree-global unique id for this construct, use `uniqueId`.



      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: locked

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.locked>`

      Returns true if this construct or any of it's parent constructs are

      locked.



      *Protected property*

      :type: boolean *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: metadata

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.metadata>`

      An array of metadata objects associated with this construct.

      This can be used, for example, to implement support for deprecation notices, source mapping, etc.



      :type: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.MetadataEntry`\ [] *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: path

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.path>`

      The full path of this construct in the tree.

      Components are separated by '/'.



      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: uniqueId

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.uniqueId>`

      A tree-global unique alphanumeric identifier for this construct.

      Includes all components of the tree.



      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: parent

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.parent>`

      Returns the parent of this node or undefined if this is a root node.



      :type: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\  *(optional)* *(readonly)*


VpcSubnetProps (interface)
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

.. py:class:: VpcSubnetProps

   **Language-specific names:**

   .. tabs::

      .. code-tab:: c#

         using Amazon.CDK.AWS.EC2;

      .. code-tab:: java

         import software.amazon.awscdk.services.ec2.VpcSubnetProps;

      .. code-tab:: javascript

         // VpcSubnetProps is an interface

      .. code-tab:: typescript

         import { VpcSubnetProps } from '@aws-cdk/aws-ec2';



   Specify configuration parameters for a VPC subnet





   .. py:attribute:: availabilityZone

      The availability zone for the subnet



      :type: string


   .. py:attribute:: cidrBlock

      The CIDR notation for this subnet



      :type: string


   .. py:attribute:: vpcId

      The VPC which this subnet is part of



      :type: string


   .. py:attribute:: mapPublicIpOnLaunch

      Controls if a public IP is associated to an instance at launch

      

      Defaults to true in Subnet.Public, false in Subnet.Private or Subnet.Isolated.



      :type: boolean *(optional)*


   .. py:attribute:: tags

      The AWS resource tags to associate with the Subnet



      :type: string => string *(optional)*


VpcSubnetRef
^^^^^^^^^^^^

.. py:class:: VpcSubnetRef(parent, id)

   **Language-specific names:**

   .. tabs::

      .. code-tab:: c#

      .. code-tab:: java

      .. code-tab:: typescript

         import { VpcSubnetRef } from '@aws-cdk/aws-ec2';



   A new or imported VPC Subnet



   :extends: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 
   :implements: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.IDependable`\ 
   :abstract: Yes
   :param parent: The parent construct
   :type parent: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 
   :param id: The local logical ID of the construct. Must be unique amongst siblings. If the ID includes a path separator (`/`), then it will be replaced by double dash `--`.
   :type id: string

   .. py:staticmethod:: import(parent, name, props) -> @aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcSubnetRef

      :param parent: 
      :type parent: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 
      :param name: 
      :type name: string
      :param props: 
      :type props: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcSubnetRefProps`\ 
      :rtype: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.VpcSubnetRef`\

WindowsImage
^^^^^^^^^^^^

.. py:class:: WindowsImage(version)

   **Language-specific names:**

   .. tabs::

      .. code-tab:: c#

         using Amazon.CDK.AWS.EC2;

      .. code-tab:: java

         import software.amazon.awscdk.services.ec2.WindowsImage;

      .. code-tab:: javascript

         const { WindowsImage } = require('@aws-cdk/aws-ec2');

      .. code-tab:: typescript

         import { WindowsImage } from '@aws-cdk/aws-ec2';



   Select the latest version of the indicated Windows version

   

   The AMI ID is selected using the values published to the SSM parameter store.

   

   https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/mt/query-for-the-latest-windows-ami-using-systems-manager-parameter-store/



   :implements: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.IMachineImageSource`\ 
   :param version: 
   :type version: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.WindowsVersion`\ 

   .. py:method:: getImage(parent) -> @aws-cdk/aws-ec2.MachineImage

      *Implements* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.IMachineImageSource.getImage`

      Return the image to use in the given context



      :param parent: 
      :type parent: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 
      :rtype: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.MachineImage`\ 


   .. py:attribute:: version

      :type: :py:class:`~@aws-cdk/aws-ec2.WindowsVersion`\  *(readonly)*

         import { WindowsVersion } from '@aws-cdk/aws-ec2';



   The Windows version to use for the WindowsImage

   .. py:method:: addError(message) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addError>`

      Adds an { error: <message> } metadata entry to this construct.

      The toolkit will fail synthesis when errors are reported.



      :param message: The error message.
      :type message: string
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: addInfo(message) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addInfo>`

      Adds a { "aws:cdk:info": <message> } metadata entry to this construct.

      The toolkit will display the info message when apps are synthesized.



      :param message: The info message.
      :type message: string
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: addMetadata(type, data, [from]) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addMetadata>`

      Adds a metadata entry to this construct.

      Entries are arbitrary values and will also include a stack trace to allow tracing back to

      the code location for when the entry was added. It can be used, for example, to include source

      mapping in CloudFormation templates to improve diagnostics.



      :param type: a string denoting the type of metadata
      :type type: string
      :param data: the value of the metadata (can be a Token). If null/undefined, metadata will not be added.
      :type data: any
      :param from: a function under which to restrict the metadata entry's stack trace (defaults to this.addMetadata)
      :type from: any *(optional)*
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: addWarning(message) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.addWarning>`

      Adds a { warning: <message> } metadata entry to this construct.

      The toolkit will display the warning when an app is synthesized, or fail

      if run in --strict mode.



      :param message: The warning message.
      :type message: string
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: ancestors([upTo]) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct[]

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.ancestors>`

      Return the ancestors (including self) of this Construct up until and excluding the indicated component



      :param upTo: 
      :type upTo: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\  *(optional)*

   .. py:method:: findChild(path) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.findChild>`

      Return a descendant by path

      

      Throws an exception if the descendant is not found.

      

      Note that if the original ID of the construct you are looking for contained

      a '/', then it would have been replaced by '--'.



      :param path: 
      :type path: string
      :return: Child with the given path.
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ 


   .. py:method:: getContext(key) -> any

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.getContext>`

      Retrieves a value from tree context.

      

      Context is usually initialized at the root, but can be overridden at any point in the tree.



      :param key: The context key
      :type key: string
      :return: The context value or undefined
      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: lock()

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.lock>`

      Locks this construct from allowing more children to be added. After this

      call, no more children can be added to this construct or to any children.



      *Protected method*



   .. py:method:: requireContext(key) -> any

      It is an error if the context object is not available.



      :param key: 
      :type key: string
      :rtype: any

      *Protected method*

      :type props: any

   .. py:method:: setContext(key, value)

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.setContext>`

      This can be used to set contextual values.

      Context must be set before any children are added, since children may consult context info during construction.

      If the key already exists, it will be overridden.



      :param key: The context key
      :type key: string
      :param value: The context value
      :type value: any

   .. py:method:: validate() -> string[]

      validation logic. It is called on all constructs before synthesis.



      :return: An array of validation error messages, or an empty array if there the construct is valid.
      :rtype: string[]


   .. py:method:: validateTree() -> @aws-cdk/cdk.ValidationError[]

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.validateTree>`

      Invokes 'validate' on all child constructs and then on this construct (depth-first).



      :return: A list of validation errors. If the list is empty, all constructs are valid.
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.ValidationError`\ []

   .. py:method:: addOverride(path, value)

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Resource <@aws-cdk/cdk.Resource.addOverride>`

      Adds an override to the synthesized CloudFormation resource. To add a

      property override, either use `addPropertyOverride` or prefix `path` with

      "Properties." (i.e. `Properties.TopicName`).



      :param path: The path of the property, you can use dot notation to override values in complex types. Any intermdediate keys will be created as needed.
      :type path: string
      :param value: The value. Could be primitive or complex.
      :type value: any


   .. py:method:: addPropertyDeletionOverride(propertyPath)

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Resource <@aws-cdk/cdk.Resource.addPropertyDeletionOverride>`

      Adds an override that deletes the value of a property from the resource definition.



      :param propertyPath: The path to the property.
      :type propertyPath: string


   .. py:method:: addPropertyOverride(propertyPath, value)

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Resource <@aws-cdk/cdk.Resource.addPropertyOverride>`

      Adds an override to a resource property.

      

      Syntactic sugar for `addOverride("Properties.<...>", value)`.



      :param propertyPath: The path of the property
      :type propertyPath: string
      :param value: The value
      :type value: any

      in case there is no generated attribute.



      :param attributeName: The name of the attribute.

   .. py:attribute:: untypedPropertyOverrides

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Resource <@aws-cdk/cdk.Resource.untypedPropertyOverrides>`

      AWS resource property overrides.

      

      During synthesis, the method "renderProperties(this.overrides)" is called

      with this object, and merged on top of the output of

      "renderProperties(this.properties)".

      

      Derived classes should expose a strongly-typed version of this object as

      a public property called `propertyOverrides`.



      *Protected property*

      :type: any *(readonly)*

   .. py:method:: getContext(key) -> any

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.getContext>`

      Retrieves a value from tree context.

      

      Context is usually initialized at the root, but can be overridden at any point in the tree.



      :param key: The context key
      :type key: string
      :return: The context value or undefined
      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: lock()

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.lock>`

      Locks this construct from allowing more children to be added. After this

      call, no more children can be added to this construct or to any children.



      *Protected method*



   .. py:method:: requireContext(key) -> any

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.requireContext>`

      Retrieve a value from tree-global context

      

      It is an error if the context object is not available.



      :param key: 
      :type key: string
      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: required(props, name) -> any

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.required>`

      Throws if the `props` bag doesn't include the property `name`.

      In the future we can add some type-checking here, maybe even auto-generate during compilation.



      *Protected method*

      :param props: The props bag.
      :type props: any
      :param name: The name of the required property.
      :type name: string
      :rtype: any


   .. py:method:: setContext(key, value)

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.setContext>`

      This can be used to set contextual values.

      Context must be set before any children are added, since children may consult context info during construction.

      If the key already exists, it will be overridden.



      :param key: The context key
      :type key: string
      :param value: The context value
      :type value: any


   .. py:method:: toString() -> string

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.toString>`

      Returns a string representation of this construct.



      :rtype: string


   .. py:method:: toTreeString([depth]) -> string

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.toTreeString>`

      Returns a string with a tree representation of this construct and it's children.



      :param depth: 
      :type depth: number *(optional)*
      :rtype: string


   .. py:method:: tryFindChild(path) -> @aws-cdk/cdk.Construct

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.tryFindChild>`

      Return a descendant by path, or undefined

      

      Note that if the original ID of the construct you are looking for contained

      a '/', then it would have been replaced by '--'.



      :param path: 
      :type path: string
      :return: a child by path or undefined if not found.
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\  *(optional)*


   .. py:method:: unlock()

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.unlock>`

      Unlocks this costruct and allows mutations (adding children).



      *Protected method*



   .. py:method:: validate() -> string[]

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.validate>`

      This method can be implemented by derived constructs in order to perform

      validation logic. It is called on all constructs before synthesis.



      :return: An array of validation error messages, or an empty array if there the construct is valid.
      :rtype: string[]


   .. py:method:: validateTree() -> @aws-cdk/cdk.ValidationError[]

      *Inherited from* :py:meth:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.validateTree>`

      Invokes 'validate' on all child constructs and then on this construct (depth-first).



      :return: A list of validation errors. If the list is empty, all constructs are valid.
      :rtype: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.ValidationError`\ []


   .. py:attribute:: children

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.children>`

      All direct children of this construct.



      :type: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\ [] *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: id

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.id>`

      The local id of the construct.

      This id is unique amongst its siblings.

      To obtain a tree-global unique id for this construct, use `uniqueId`.



      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: locked

      *Inherited from* :py:attr:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct <@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct.locked>`

      locked.



      *Protected property*

      :type: boolean *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: metadata

      This can be used, for example, to implement support for deprecation notices, source mapping, etc.



      :type: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.MetadataEntry`\ [] *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: path

      Components are separated by '/'.



      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: uniqueId

      Includes all components of the tree.



      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:attribute:: parent

      :type: :py:class:`@aws-cdk/cdk.Construct`\  *(optional)* *(readonly)*

      :type: string *(readonly)*


   .. py:method:: addDeletionOverride(path)

      :type path: string
